title: Drunk mum lets go of pram leaving daughter, 2, hurtling towards traffic
text:

A drunk mum let go of her daughter's pram - leaving the two-year-old speeding towards traffic.

Police were forced to step into and grab the pushchair as it hurtled towards the road close to a retail park in Huddersfield.

The two-year-old's mum Ayesha Miller was in an intoxicated state with the wheels of the pram veering towards the edge of the road.

She appeared at Kirklees Magistrates' Court and pleaded guilty to being drunk in charge of a child.

Police were called to the shopping complex shortly after 6pm on Monday, September 16.

(Image: MEN MEDIA)

Vanessa Jones, prosecuting, said: “They were contacted because people had seen Miller with the young child on the retail park.

“The child was in the pram and the person in charge of the child seemed to be intoxicated.

“She pushed the baby across the main road, holding up traffic and she seemed to be stumbling around.

“Officers attended and saw her with the pram. At one point she let go and the pram veered to the edge of the pavement, the front wheels going into the road into the path of oncoming traffic.

“Police had to take hold of the pram and on speaking with Miss Miller realised she was intoxicated.”

The 27-year-old was asked to provide a breath sample at the roadside.

This gave a reading of 126 micrograms of alcohol in 100 millilitres of breath.

This is more than three-and-a-half times the legal drink driving limit of 35 micrograms.

Miller's solicitor Ian Whiteley explained that she has three children and things are normally fine when they are at school.

He said: “She found it difficult during the summer months with the children at home full time with her (and had been) drinking heavily.

“This time she'd gone to a friend's house and taken the two-year-old with her in the pram.

“Perhaps in hindsight she shouldn't have done that.”

Mr Whiteley said that his client has now cut back on her alcohol consumption.

Magistrates told Miller, of Leeds Road in Huddersfield, they need a full report before sentencing her on Thursday, October 31.

She was granted unconditional bail.
description: Ayesha Miller pleaded guilty to being drunk in charge of a child after getting spotted by police on a Monday afternoon
